item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, February 7, 2025 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Casinos, high-rises and fraud: The BBC visits a city built on scams (89 points | 24 comments)
2. Donald Knuth's 2024 Christmas Lecture: Strong and Weak Components [video] (182 points | 18 comments)
3. Meta torrented & seeded 81.7 TB dataset containing copyrighted data (117 points | 62 comments)
4. Transformer – Spreadsheet (210 points | 16 comments)
5. Easy 6502 (120 points | 16 comments)
6. Copilot stops working on code that contains hardcoded banned words from GitHub (77 points | 20 comments)
7. InspectMind AI (YC W24) Is Hiring for AI in Construction ( | hide)
8. Understanding Reasoning LLMs (314 points | 118 comments)
9. There's Math.random(), and then there's Math.random() (2015) (48 points | 25 comments)
10. Emil's Story as a Self-Taught AI Researcher (2020) (19 points | discuss)
11. Robust autonomy emerges from self-play (88 points | 45 comments)
12. Announcing the data.gov archive (227 points | 62 comments)
13. Experience the DeepSeek R1 Distilled 'Reasoning' Models on Ryzen AI and Radeon (20 points | 3 comments)
14. Kill the "user": Musings of a disillusioned technologist (73 points | 46 comments)
15. Show HN: SQLite disk page explorer (234 points | 31 comments)
16. Simulating water over terrain (330 points | 51 comments)
17. Google Fixes Android Kernel Zero-Day Exploited in Attacks (25 points | 8 comments)
18. The most breathtaking abandoned sites (32 points | 6 comments)
19. OpenLDK: A Java JIT compiler and runtime in Common Lisp (173 points | 56 comments)
20. How does life happen when there's barely any light? (30 points | 22 comments)
21. Steve Meretzky – Working with Douglas Adams on the Hitchhiker's Guide (128 points | 29 comments)
22. AI by Hand Exercises in Excel (62 points | 4 comments)
23. Boeing reports Starliner losses of more than half a billion dollars in 2024 (18 points | 9 comments)
24. Aluminum batteries outlive lithium-ion with a pinch of salt (206 points | 120 comments)
25. Show HN: An homage to Tom Dowdy's 1991 screensaver, "Kaos" (134 points | 63 comments)
26. HTML whitespace is broken (2024) (77 points | 33 comments)
27. There may not be aha moment in R1-Zero-like training (62 points | 6 comments)
28. It is time to standardize principles and practices for software memory safety (64 points | 53 comments)
29. OpenAI cofounder John Schulman is joining Mira Murati's startup (6 points | 1 comment)
30. Keep 'em (not) separated: detecting discontinuities in grid graphs (19 points | 9 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, February 7, 2025 at 12:30 PM UTC
